turn.1: where is the best place to go skiing in australia
turn.2: The Kosciuszko Main Range in the Snowy Mountains of New South Wales offer some of the most challenging cross-country and back-country skiing in Australia, notably Watsons Crags and Mount Twynam on the steep Western Face of the Range.
turn.3: are there any other good places to go skiing
turn.4: The Mount Jagungal wilderness area provides some of the most isolated back-country ski terrain.
turn.5: are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: High country huts, often a legacy of the era of cattle grazing in the mountains, provide emergency shelter in these regions.
turn.7: where else can you go skiing
turn.8: Dedicated Cross Country ski resorts are located at Lake Mountain, Mount Stirling and Mount St Gwinear in Victoria and popular areas for back country skiing and ski touring in the Alpine National Park, Yarra Ranges National Park and the Baw Baw National Park include: Mount Bogong, Mount Feathertop, Bogong High Plains, Mount Howitt, Mount Reynard and Snowy Plains.
turn.9: do people race in the skiing
turn.10: The Kangaroo Hoppet is a leg of the Worldloppet cross-country race series which is conducted on the last Saturday of August each year, hosted by Falls Creek in Victoria.
turn.12: The showpiece 42-kilometre race attracts thousands of spectators and competitors.
